old_updates.data: Ground systems could delay Artemis 2 launch

data.content:
Missed our open day this year?

No worries, we've got you...

On 5 and 6 October 2024, we opened the doors to our Netherlands site. Here, the public met space engineers, astronauts and to saw actual space hardware. 

See you again next year! 

 https://t.co/cdVbpn3pTm https://t.co/gOeHxagIuA

Hey students!  Looking for your winter internship? We got you covered! We have various internships offers for the winter in engineering, project management, computer science, astronomy and more! Check them out  https://t.co/AcZInvPm2V https://t.co/yyZVdq7sH3

One step closer to Apophis!
 
We have signed a contract with OHB Italia SpA to begin preparatory work on our proposed Ramses mission to the infamous asteroid Apophis.
 
Ramses aims to rendezvous with the asteroid and accompany it through its close encounter with Earth in 2029. https://t.co/gcZOEfTChd

Following three days of intensive panels and events, we bring you day 4 of #IAC2024!

Stay tuned for exciting announcements throughout the day. 

 Full programme  https://t.co/j24UXsuhAs

Take a look back at day 3   https://t.co/4WQKBrkOtf https://t.co/akLjz58Du0

data.content: Adaptation to microgravity triggers body changes similar to accelerated aging, making it fascinating to study astronauts health in space. Discover how studies on the ISS can benefit both astronauts and people on Earth. https://t.co/RVUZ9ALFDE

Marvelling at the Moons beauty! Look up tonight to see the Hunters Moon. 

 Samil Cabrera https://t.co/jB1FJpD4nk

Today, we unveil the first image from all four of our @ESA_EO EarthCARE mission instruments at  #IAC2024.

These new results clearly highlight how these four advanced sensors work in synergy to measure exactly how clouds and aerosols influence the heating and cooling of our https://t.co/LgdPMefkEq
